data.question: What is the title of the article?
data.answer: Control the Structure of Zr-Tetracarboxylate Frameworks through Steric Tuning

data.question: Who are the corresponding authors of the article?
What is the main focus of the research article?
data.answer: The main focus is on controlling the structure of Zr-tetracarboxylate-based metal-organic frameworks (MOFs) through steric tuning.

data.question: True or False: The article was published in the Journal of the American Chemical Society.
What types of topologies were obtained in the study?
How many types of Zr-MOFs were synthesized using different ligands?
data.answer: Three types of Zr-MOFs were synthesized.

data.question: True or False: The formation mechanism of different structures was studied through molecular simulations.
What role do the substituents on the ligands play in the formation of MOF structures?
data.answer: The steric hindrance of the substituents dictates the resulting MOF structures.

data.question: True or False: The article discusses the synthesis of Zr-MOFs with only one type of topology.
What is the significance of the mixed linker strategy mentioned in the article?
data.answer: The mixed linker strategy allows for the controllable formation of different structures by selecting combinations of linkers with different steric effects.

data.question: True or False: The article provides a detailed synthesis procedure for each ligand used in the study.
What is the DOI of the article?
True or False: The porosity of the MOFs was not analyzed in the study.
What method was used to analyze the crystal structures of the synthesized MOFs?
True or False: All synthesized MOFs exhibited the same level of flexibility and porosity.
What was the role of substituents at the R1 and R2 positions in controlling MOF structures?
data.answer: Substituents at the R1 and R2 positions were used to control the rotation of the ligands, influencing the formation of different MOF structures.

data.question: True or False: The study successfully implemented the controllable formation of different MOF structures using a combination of linkers.
What is the impact of linker geometry on the formation of Zr-MOFs?
data.answer: The geometry and connectivity of a linker often dictate the structure of the resulting MOF, allowing for tunability in size, shape, and internal surface properties.

data.question: True or False: The article was published in 2017.
What experimental techniques were used to characterize the synthesized MOFs?
data.answer: Techniques used include 1H NMR spectroscopy, powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD), and N2 sorption measurements.
